bind.description: Port without IP(18083) or port with specified IP(127.0.0.1:18083).
bind.label: bind

num_acceptors.description: Socket acceptor pool for TCP protocols.
num_acceptors.label: num_acceptors

backlog.description: Defines the maximum length that the queue of pending connections can grow to.
backlog.label: backlog

enable.description: Set to false to disable this auth provider
enable.label: enable

server.description:
The IPv4 or IPv6 address or host name to connect to.
A host entry has the following form: 'Host[:Port]'
The MySQL default port 3306 is used if '[:Port]' isn't present
server.label: server

name.description: Unique name of the EMQX node. It must follow %name%@FQDN or %name%@IP format.
name.label: name

cookie.description:
Secret cookie is a random string that should be the same on all nodes in
 the given EMQX cluster, but unique per EMQX cluster. It is used to prevent EMQX nodes that
 belong to different clusters from accidentally connecting to each other.
cookie.label: cookie

data_dir.description: Path to the persistent data directory. It must be unique per broker instance.
data_dir.label: data_dir

config_files.description:
List of configuration files that are read during startup. The order is
 significant: later configuration files override the previous ones.
config_files.label: config_files

crash_dump_file.description: Location of the crash dump file
crash_dump_file.label: crash_dump_file

crash_dump_seconds.description:
The number of seconds that the broker is allowed to spend writing
a crash dump
crash_dump_seconds.label: crash_dump_seconds

crash_dump_bytes.description: The maximum size of a crash dump file in bytes.
crash_dump_bytes.label: crash_dump_bytes

dist_net_ticktime.description: This is the approximate time an EMQX node may be unresponsive until it is considered down and thereby disconnected.
dist_net_ticktime.label: dist_net_ticktime

dist_listen_min.description: Lower bound for the port range where EMQX broker listens for peer connections.
dist_listen_min.label: dist_listen_min

dist_listen_max.description: Upper bound for the port range where EMQX broker listens for peer connections.
dist_listen_max.label: dist_listen_max

backtrace_depth.description: Maximum depth of the call stack printed in error messages and process_info.
backtrace_depth.label: backtrace_depth

applications.description:
List of Erlang applications that shall be rebooted when the EMQX broker joins
 the cluster.
applications.label: applications

cacertfile.description:
Trusted PEM format CA certificates bundle file.
The certificates in this file are used to verify the TLS peer's certificates. Append new certificates to the file if new CAs are to be trusted. There is no need to restart EMQX to have the updated file loaded, because the system regularly checks if file has been updated (and reload).
NOTE: invalidating (deleting) a certificate from the file will not affect already established connections.
cacertfile.label: cacertfile

certfile.description:
PEM format certificates chain file.
The certificates in this file should be in reversed order of the certificate issue chain. That is, the host's certificate should be placed in the beginning of the file, followed by the immediate issuer certificate and so on. Although the root CA certificate is optional, it should be placed at the end of the file if it is to be added.
certfile.label: certfile

password.description:
String containing the user's password. Only used if the private
key file is password-protected.
password.label: password

versions.description:
All TLS/DTLS versions to be supported.
NOTE: PSK ciphers are suppressed by 'tlsv1.3' version config
In case PSK cipher suites are intended, make sure to configured ['tlsv1.2', 'tlsv1.1'] here.
versions.label: versions

ciphers.description:
This config holds TLS cipher suite names separated by comma, or as an array of strings. e.g. "TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384,TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256" or ["TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384","TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256"].
Ciphers (and their ordering) define the way in which the client and server encrypts information over the network connection. Selecting a good cipher suite is critical for the application's data security, confidentiality and performance. The names should be in OpenSSL string format (not RFC format). All default values and examples provided by EMQX config documentation are all in OpenSSL format.
NOTE: Certain cipher suites are only compatible with specific TLS versions ('tlsv1.1', 'tlsv1.2' or 'tlsv1.3') incompatible cipher suites will be silently dropped. For instance, if only 'tlsv1.3' is given in the versions, configuring cipher suites for other versions will have no effect.
NOTE: PSK ciphers are suppressed by 'tlsv1.3' version config
If PSK cipher suites are intended, 'tlsv1.3' should be disabled from versions.
PSK cipher suites: "RSA-PSK-AES256-GCM-SHA384,RSA-PSK-AES256-CBC-SHA384, RSA-PSK-AES128-GCM-SHA256,RSA-PSK-AES128-CBC-SHA256, RSA-PSK-AES256-CBC-SHA,RSA-PSK-AES128-CBC-SHA, RSA-PSK-DES-CBC3-SHA,RSA-PSK-RC4-SHA"
ciphers.label: ciphers

secure_renegotiate.description:
SSL parameter renegotiation is a feature that allows a client and a server
to renegotiate the parameters of the SSL connection on the fly.
RFC 5746 defines a more secure way of doing this. By enabling secure renegotiation,
you drop support for the insecure renegotiation, prone to MitM attacks.
secure_renegotiate.label: secure_renegotiate

server_name_indication.description:
Specify the host name to be used in TLS Server Name Indication extension.
For instance, when connecting to "server.example.net", the genuine server which accepts the connection and performs TLS handshake may differ from the host the TLS client initially connects to, e.g. when connecting to an IP address or when the host has multiple resolvable DNS records
If not specified, it will default to the host name string which is used to establish the connection, unless it is IP addressed used.
The host name is then also used in the host name verification of the peer certificate.
The special value 'disable' prevents the Server Name Indication extension from being sent and disables the hostname verification check.
server_name_indication.label: server_name_indication

authentication.description: Per-listener authentication override Authentication can be one single authenticator instance or a chain of authenticators as an array. When authenticating a login (username, client ID, etc.) the authenticators are checked in the configured order.
authentication.label: authentication

request_timeout.description: The timeout when sending request to the HTTP server
request_timeout.label: request_timeout

enable.description: React on system overload or not
enable.label: enable

backoff_delay.description: Some unimportant tasks could be delayed for execution, here set the delays in ms
backoff_delay.label: backoff_delay

backoff_new_conn.description: Close new incoming connections if necessary
backoff_new_conn.label: backoff_new_conn

cacertfile.description:
Trusted PEM format CA certificates bundle file.
The certificates in this file are used to verify the TLS peer's certificates. Append new certificates to the file if new CAs are to be trusted. There is no need to restart EMQX to have the updated file loaded, because the system regularly checks if file has been updated (and reload).
NOTE: invalidating (deleting) a certificate from the file will not affect already established connections.
cacertfile.label: cacertfile

certfile.description:
PEM format certificates chain file.
The certificates in this file should be in reversed order of the certificate issue chain. That is, the host's certificate should be placed in the beginning of the file, followed by the immediate issuer certificate and so on. Although the root CA certificate is optional, it should be placed at the end of the file if it is to be added.
certfile.label: certfile

password.description:
String containing the user's password. Only used if the private
key file is password-protected.
password.label: password

versions.description:
All TLS/DTLS versions to be supported.
NOTE: PSK ciphers are suppressed by 'tlsv1.3' version config
In case PSK cipher suites are intended, make sure to configured ['tlsv1.2', 'tlsv1.1'] here.
versions.label: versions

ciphers.description:
This config holds TLS cipher suite names separated by comma, or as an array of strings. e.g. "TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384,TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256" or ["TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384","TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256"].
Ciphers (and their ordering) define the way in which the client and server encrypts information over the network connection. Selecting a good cipher suite is critical for the application's data security, confidentiality and performance. The names should be in OpenSSL string format (not RFC format). All default values and examples provided by EMQX config documentation are all in OpenSSL format.
NOTE: Certain cipher suites are only compatible with specific TLS versions ('tlsv1.1', 'tlsv1.2' or 'tlsv1.3') incompatible cipher suites will be silently dropped. For instance, if only 'tlsv1.3' is given in the versions, configuring cipher suites for other versions will have no effect.
NOTE: PSK ciphers are suppressed by 'tlsv1.3' version config
If PSK cipher suites are intended, 'tlsv1.3' should be disabled from versions.
PSK cipher suites: "RSA-PSK-AES256-GCM-SHA384,RSA-PSK-AES256-CBC-SHA384, RSA-PSK-AES128-GCM-SHA256,RSA-PSK-AES128-CBC-SHA256, RSA-PSK-AES256-CBC-SHA,RSA-PSK-AES128-CBC-SHA, RSA-PSK-DES-CBC3-SHA,RSA-PSK-RC4-SHA"
ciphers.label: ciphers

secure_renegotiate.description:
SSL parameter renegotiation is a feature that allows a client and a server
to renegotiate the parameters of the SSL connection on the fly.
RFC 5746 defines a more secure way of doing this. By enabling secure renegotiation,
you drop support for the insecure renegotiation, prone to MitM attacks.
secure_renegotiate.label: secure_renegotiate

dhfile.description:
Path to a file containing PEM-encoded Diffie Hellman parameters to be used by the server if a cipher suite using Diffie Hellman key exchange is negotiated. If not specified, default parameters are used.
NOTE: The dhfile option is not supported by TLS 1.3.
dhfile.label: dhfile

fail_if_no_peer_cert.description:
Used together with {verify, verify_peer} by an TLS/DTLS server.
If set to true, the server fails if the client does not have a
certificate to send, that is, sends an empty certificate.
If set to false, it fails only if the client sends an invalid
certificate (an empty certificate is considered valid).
fail_if_no_peer_cert.label: fail_if_no_peer_cert

client_renegotiation.description:
In protocols that support client-initiated renegotiation,
the cost of resources of such an operation is higher for the server than the client.
This can act as a vector for denial of service attacks.
The SSL application already takes measures to counter-act such attempts,
but client-initiated renegotiation can be strictly disabled by setting this option to false.
The default value is true. Note that disabling renegotiation can result in
long-lived connections becoming unusable due to limits on
the number of messages the underlying cipher suite can encipher.
client_renegotiation.label: client_renegotiation

payload_encode.description:
Determine the format of the payload format in the trace file.
`text`: Text-based protocol or plain text protocol. It is recommended when payload is JSON encoded.
`hex`: Binary hexadecimal encode. It is recommended when payload is a custom binary protocol.
`hidden`: payload is obfuscated as `******`
payload_encode.label: payload_encode

authentication.description: Per-listener authentication override Authentication can be one single authenticator instance or a chain of authenticators as an array. When authenticating a login (username, client ID, etc.) the authenticators are checked in the configured order.
authentication.label: authentication

level.description: Global log level. This includes the primary log level and all log handlers.
level.label: level

chars_limit.description: Set the maximum length of a single log message. If this length is exceeded, the log message will be truncated.
chars_limit.label: chars_limit

formatter.description: Choose log format. text for free text, and json for structured logging.
formatter.label: formatter

single_line.description: Print logs in a single line if set to true. Otherwise, log messages may span multiple lines.
single_line.label: single_line

max_depth.description: Maximum depth for Erlang term log formatting and Erlang process message queue inspection.
max_depth.label: max_depth

idle_timeout.description:
Close TCP connections from the clients that have not sent MQTT CONNECT
message within this interval.
idle_timeout.label: idle_timeout

max_clientid_len.description: Maximum allowed length of MQTT clientId.
max_clientid_len.label: max_clientid_len

max_topic_alias.description: Maximum Topic Alias, 0 means no topic alias supported.
max_topic_alias.label: max_topic_alias

ignore_loop_deliver.description: Ignore loop delivery of messages for MQTT v3.1.1.
ignore_loop_deliver.label: ignore_loop_deliver

strict_mode.description: Parse the MQTT frame in strict mode.
strict_mode.label: strict_mode

response_information.description:
Specify the response information returned to the client
This feature is disabled if is set to "".
response_information.label: response_information

server_keepalive.description:
'Server Keep Alive' of MQTT 5.0.
If the server returns a 'Server Keep Alive' in the CONNACK packet,
the client MUST use that value instead of the value it sent as the 'Keep Alive'.
server_keepalive.label: server_keepalive

keepalive_backoff.description:
The backoff for MQTT keepalive timeout. The broker will close the connection
after idling for 'Keepalive * backoff * 2'.
keepalive_backoff.label: keepalive_backoff

upgrade_qos.description: Force upgrade of QoS level according to subscription.
upgrade_qos.label: upgrade_qos

max_inflight.description: Maximum size of the Inflight Window storing QoS1/2 messages delivered but un-acked.
max_inflight.label: max_inflight

retry_interval.description: Retry interval for QoS1/2 message delivering.
retry_interval.label: retry_interval

max_awaiting_rel.description: Maximum QoS2 packets (Client -> Broker) awaiting PUBREL.
max_awaiting_rel.label: max_awaiting_rel

await_rel_timeout.description: The QoS2 messages (Client -> Broker) will be dropped if awaiting PUBREL timeout.
await_rel_timeout.label: await_rel_timeout

session_expiry_interval.description: Default session expiry interval for MQTT V3.1.1 connections.
session_expiry_interval.label: session_expiry_interval

max_mqueue_len.description:
Maximum queue length. Enqueued messages when persistent client disconnected,
or inflight window is full.
max_mqueue_len.label: max_mqueue_len

mqueue_priorities.description:
Topic priorities.
There's no priority table by default, hence all messages are treated equal.
Priority number [1-255]
**NOTE**: Comma and equal signs are not allowed for priority topic names.
**NOTE**: Messages for topics not in the priority table are treated as either highest or lowest priority depending on the configured value for mqtt.mqueue_default_priority.

**Examples**: To configure "topic/1" > "topic/2":
mqueue_priorities: {"topic/1": 10, "topic/2": 8}
mqueue_priorities.label: mqueue_priorities

mqueue_default_priority.description: Default to the highest priority for topics not matching priority table.
mqueue_default_priority.label: mqueue_default_priority

use_username_as_clientid.description: Replace client ID with the username.
use_username_as_clientid.label: use_username_as_clientid

peer_cert_as_username.description:
Use the CN, DN or CRT field from the client certificate as a username.
Only works for the TLS connection.
peer_cert_as_username.label: peer_cert_as_username

peer_cert_as_clientid.description:
Use the CN, DN or CRT field from the client certificate as a clientid.
Only works for the TLS connection.
peer_cert_as_clientid.label: peer_cert_as_clientid

enable.description: Set to false to disable this auth provider
enable.label: enable

connect_timeout.description: The timeout when connecting to the HTTP server
connect_timeout.label: connect_timeout

max_retries.description: Max retry times if error on sending request
max_retries.label: max_retries

request.description: If the request is provided, the caller can send HTTP requests via emqx_resource:query(ResourceId, {send_message, BridgeId, Message})
request.label: request

retry_interval.description: Interval before next retry if error on sending request
retry_interval.label: retry_interval

count.description: GC the process after this many received messages.
count.label: count

bytes.description: GC the process after specified number of bytes have passed through.
bytes.label: bytes

enable.description: Set to false to disable this auth provider
enable.label: enable

servers.description:
A Node list for Cluster to connect to. The nodes should be split with ',', such as: 'Node[,Node]'
For each Node should be:
The IPv4 or IPv6 address or host name to connect to.
A host entry has the following form: 'Host[:Port]'
The Redis default port 6379 is used if '[:Port]' isn't present
servers.label: servers

level.description: Global log level. This includes the primary log level and all log handlers.
level.label: level

chars_limit.description: Set the maximum length of a single log message. If this length is exceeded, the log message will be truncated.
chars_limit.label: chars_limit

formatter.description: Choose log format. text for free text, and json for structured logging.
formatter.label: formatter

single_line.description: Print logs in a single line if set to true. Otherwise, log messages may span multiple lines.
single_line.label: single_line

max_depth.description: Maximum depth for Erlang term log formatting and Erlang process message queue inspection.
max_depth.label: max_depth

enable.description: Set to false to disable this auth provider
enable.label: enable

enable.description: Set to false to disable this auth provider
enable.label: enable

servers.description:
A Node list for Cluster to connect to. The nodes should be split with ',', such as: 'Node[,Node]'
For each Node should be:
The IPv4 or IPv6 address or host name to connect to.
A host entry has the following form: 'Host[:Port]'
The MongoDB default port 27017 is used if '[:Port]' isn't present
servers.label: servers

num_items.description: The number of top processes per monitoring group
num_items.label: num_items

sample_interval.description: Specifies how often process top should be collected
sample_interval.label: sample_interval

max_procs.description:
Stop collecting data when the number of processes
in the VM exceeds this value
max_procs.label: max_procs

db_hostname.description: Hostname of the PostgreSQL database that collects the data points
db_hostname.label: db_hostname

db_port.description: Port of the PostgreSQL database that collects the data points
db_port.label: db_port

db_username.description: EMQX username in the PostgreSQL database
db_username.label: db_username

db_password.description: EMQX user password in the PostgreSQL database
db_password.label: db_password

enable.description: Set to false to disable this auth provider
enable.label: enable

server.description:
The IPv4 or IPv6 address or host name to connect to.
A host entry has the following form: 'Host[:Port]'
The Redis default port 6379 is used if '[:Port]' isn't present
server.label: server

enable.description: Set to false to disable this auth provider
enable.label: enable

enable.description: Set to false to disable this auth provider
enable.label: enable

servers.description:
A Node list for Cluster to connect to. The nodes should be split with ',', such as: 'Node[,Node]'
For each Node should be:
The IPv4 or IPv6 address or host name to connect to.
A host entry has the following form: 'Host[:Port]'
The Redis default port 6379 is used if '[:Port]' isn't present
servers.label: servers

retry_interval.description: Time interval to retry after a failed call.
retry_interval.label: retry_interval

max_history.description: Retain the maximum number of completed transactions (for queries).
max_history.label: max_history

cleanup_interval.description:
Time interval to clear completed but stale transactions.
Ensure that the number of completed transactions is less than the max_history.
cleanup_interval.label: cleanup_interval

enable.description: React on system overload or not
enable.label: enable

backoff_delay.description: Some unimportant tasks could be delayed for execution, here set the delays in ms
backoff_delay.label: backoff_delay

backoff_new_conn.description: Close new incoming connections if necessary
backoff_new_conn.label: backoff_new_conn

count.description: GC the process after this many received messages.
count.label: count

bytes.description: GC the process after specified number of bytes have passed through.
bytes.label: bytes

enable.description: Set to false to disable this auth provider
enable.label: enable

connect_timeout.description: The timeout when connecting to the HTTP server
connect_timeout.label: connect_timeout

max_retries.description: Max retry times if error on sending request
max_retries.label: max_retries

request.description: If the request is provided, the caller can send HTTP requests via emqx_resource:query(ResourceId, {send_message, BridgeId, Message})
request.label: request

retry_interval.description: Interval before next retry if error on sending request
retry_interval.label: retry_interval

low_water_mark.description:
If the remaining tokens are lower than this value,
the check/consume will succeed, but it will be forced to wait for a short period of time.
low_water_mark.label: low_water_mark

capacity.description: The capacity of the token bucket.
capacity.label: capacity

divisible.description: Is it possible to split the number of requested tokens?
divisible.label: divisible

max_retry_time.description: The maximum retry time when acquire failed.
max_retry_time.label: max_retry_time

failure_strategy.description: The strategy when all the retries failed.
failure_strategy.label: failure_strategy

enable.description: Set to false to disable this auth provider
enable.label: enable

server.description:
The IPv4 or IPv6 address or host name to connect to.
A host entry has the following form: 'Host[:Port]'
The PostgreSQL default port 5432 is used if '[:Port]' isn't present
server.label: server

actions.description:
The actions triggered when the alarm is activated.
Currently, the following actions are supported: log and publish. log is to write the alarm to log (console or file). publish is to publish the alarm as an MQTT message to the system topics: $SYS/brokers/emqx@xx.xx.xx.x/alarms/activate and $SYS/brokers/emqx@xx.xx.xx.x/alarms/deactivate
actions.label: actions

size_limit.description:
The maximum total number of deactivated alarms to keep as history.
When this limit is exceeded, the oldest deactivated alarms are deleted to cap the total number.
size_limit.label: size_limit

validity_period.description:
Retention time of deactivated alarms. Alarms are not deleted immediately
when deactivated, but after the retention time.
validity_period.label: validity_period

enable.description: Set to false to disable this auth provider
enable.label: enable

vm.description:
This part of the configuration is responsible for collecting
 BEAM VM events, such as long garbage collection, traffic congestion in the inter-broker
 communication, etc.
vm.label: vm

os.description:
This part of the configuration is responsible for monitoring
 the host OS health, such as free memory, disk space, CPU load, etc.
os.label: os

top.description:
This part of the configuration is responsible for monitoring
 the Erlang processes in the VM. This information can be sent to an external
 PostgreSQL database. This feature is inactive unless the PostgreSQL sink is configured.
top.label: top

enable.description: Set to false to disable this auth provider
enable.label: enable

server.description:
The IPv4 or IPv6 address or host name to connect to.
A host entry has the following form: 'Host[:Port]'
The MongoDB default port 27017 is used if '[:Port]' isn't present
server.label: server

In case PSK cipher suites are intended, make sure to configured ['tlsv1.2', 'tlsv1.1'] here.

ciphers.description:
This config holds TLS cipher suite names separated by comma, or as an array of strings. e.g. "TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384,TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256" or ["TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384","TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256"].

Selecting a good cipher suite is critical for the application's data security, confidentiality and performance. The names should be in OpenSSL string format (not RFC format). All default values and examples provided by EMQX config documentation are all in OpenSSL format.
NOTE: Certain cipher suites are only compatible with specific TLS versions ('tlsv1.1', 'tlsv1.2' or 'tlsv1.3') incompatible cipher suites will be silently dropped. For instance, if only 'tlsv1.3' is given in the versions, configuring cipher suites for other versions will have no effect.

If PSK cipher suites are intended, 'tlsv1.3' should be disabled from versions.
PSK cipher suites: "RSA-PSK-AES256-GCM-SHA384,RSA-PSK-AES256-CBC-SHA384, RSA-PSK-AES128-GCM-SHA256,RSA-PSK-AES128-CBC-SHA256, RSA-PSK-AES256-CBC-SHA,RSA-PSK-AES128-CBC-SHA, RSA-PSK-DES-CBC3-SHA,RSA-PSK-RC4-SHA"

SSL parameter renegotiation is a feature that allows a client and a server

RFC 5746 defines a more secure way of doing this. By enabling secure renegotiation,
you drop support for the insecure renegotiation, prone to MitM attacks.

dhfile.description:
Path to a file containing PEM-encoded Diffie Hellman parameters to be used by the server if a cipher suite using Diffie Hellman key exchange is negotiated. If not specified, default parameters are used.
NOTE: The dhfile option is not supported by TLS 1.3.

fail_if_no_peer_cert.description:
Used together with {verify, verify_peer} by an TLS/DTLS server.
If set to true, the server fails if the client does not have a
certificate to send, that is, sends an empty certificate.
If set to false, it fails only if the client sends an invalid

In protocols that support client-initiated renegotiation,
the cost of resources of such an operation is higher for the server than the client.
This can act as a vector for denial of service attacks.
The SSL application already takes measures to counter-act such attempts,
but client-initiated renegotiation can be strictly disabled by setting this option to false.
The default value is true. Note that disabling renegotiation can result in
long-lived connections becoming unusable due to limits on

client_renegotiation.label: client_renegotiation

handshake_timeout.description: Maximum time duration allowed for the handshake to complete
handshake_timeout.label: handshake_timeout

authentication.description: Per-listener authentication override Authentication can be one single authenticator instance or a chain of authenticators as an array. When authenticating a login (username, client ID, etc.) the authenticators are checked in the configured order.
authentication.label: authentication

idle_timeout.description:
Close TCP connections from the clients that have not sent MQTT CONNECT
message within this interval.
idle_timeout.label: idle_timeout

max_clientid_len.description: Maximum allowed length of MQTT clientId.
max_clientid_len.label: max_clientid_len

max_topic_alias.description: Maximum Topic Alias, 0 means no topic alias supported.
max_topic_alias.label: max_topic_alias

ignore_loop_deliver.description: Ignore loop delivery of messages for MQTT v3.1.1.
ignore_loop_deliver.label: ignore_loop_deliver

strict_mode.description: Parse the MQTT frame in strict mode.
strict_mode.label: strict_mode

response_information.description:
Specify the response information returned to the client
This feature is disabled if is set to "".
response_information.label: response_information

server_keepalive.description:
'Server Keep Alive' of MQTT 5.0.
If the server returns a 'Server Keep Alive' in the CONNACK packet,
the client MUST use that value instead of the value it sent as the 'Keep Alive'.
server_keepalive.label: server_keepalive

keepalive_backoff.description:
The backoff for MQTT keepalive timeout. The broker will close the connection
after idling for 'Keepalive * backoff * 2'.
keepalive_backoff.label: keepalive_backoff

upgrade_qos.description: Force upgrade of QoS level according to subscription.
upgrade_qos.label: upgrade_qos

max_inflight.description: Maximum size of the Inflight Window storing QoS1/2 messages delivered but un-acked.
max_inflight.label: max_inflight

retry_interval.description: Retry interval for QoS1/2 message delivering.
retry_interval.label: retry_interval

max_awaiting_rel.description: Maximum QoS2 packets (Client -> Broker) awaiting PUBREL.
max_awaiting_rel.label: max_awaiting_rel

await_rel_timeout.description: The QoS2 messages (Client -> Broker) will be dropped if awaiting PUBREL timeout.
await_rel_timeout.label: await_rel_timeout

session_expiry_interval.description: Default session expiry interval for MQTT V3.1.1 connections.
session_expiry_interval.label: session_expiry_interval

max_mqueue_len.description:
Maximum queue length. Enqueued messages when persistent client disconnected,
or inflight window is full.
max_mqueue_len.label: max_mqueue_len

mqueue_priorities.description:
Topic priorities.
There's no priority table by default, hence all messages are treated equal.
Priority number [1-255]
**NOTE**: Comma and equal signs are not allowed for priority topic names.
**NOTE**: Messages for topics not in the priority table are treated as either highest or lowest priority depending on the configured value for mqtt.mqueue_default_priority.

**Examples**: To configure "topic/1" > "topic/2":
mqueue_priorities: {"topic/1": 10, "topic/2": 8}
mqueue_priorities.label: mqueue_priorities

mqueue_default_priority.description: Default to the highest priority for topics not matching priority table.
mqueue_default_priority.label: mqueue_default_priority

use_username_as_clientid.description: Replace client ID with the username.
use_username_as_clientid.label: use_username_as_clientid

peer_cert_as_username.description:
Use the CN, DN or CRT field from the client certificate as a username.
Only works for the TLS connection.
peer_cert_as_username.label: peer_cert_as_username

peer_cert_as_clientid.description:
Use the CN, DN or CRT field from the client certificate as a clientid.
Only works for the TLS connection.
peer_cert_as_clientid.label: peer_cert_as_clientid

enable.description: Set to false to disable this auth provider
enable.label: enable

bind.description: Port without IP(18083) or port with specified IP(127.0.0.1:18083).
bind.label: bind

num_acceptors.description: Socket acceptor pool for TCP protocols.
num_acceptors.label: num_acceptors

backlog.description: Defines the maximum length that the queue of pending connections can grow to.
backlog.label: backlog

cacertfile.description:
Trusted PEM format CA certificates bundle file.
The certificates in this file are used to verify the TLS peer's certificates. Append new certificates to the file if new CAs are to be trusted. There is no need to restart EMQX to have the updated file loaded, because the system regularly checks if file has been updated (and reload).
NOTE: invalidating (deleting) a certificate from the file will not affect already established connections.
cacertfile.label: cacertfile

certfile.description:
PEM format certificates chain file.
The certificates in this file should be in reversed order of the certificate issue chain. That is, the host's certificate should be placed in the beginning of the file, followed by the immediate issuer certificate and so on. Although the root CA certificate is optional, it should be placed at the end of the file if it is to be added.
certfile.label: certfile

password.description:
String containing the user's password. Only used if the private
key file is password-protected.
password.label: password

versions.description:
All TLS/DTLS versions to be supported.
NOTE: PSK ciphers are suppressed by 'tlsv1.3' version config
In case PSK cipher suites are intended, make sure to configured ['tlsv1.2', 'tlsv1.1'] here.
versions.label: versions

ciphers.description:
This config holds TLS cipher suite names separated by comma, or as an array of strings. e.g. "TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384,TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256" or ["TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384","TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256"].
Ciphers (and their ordering) define the way in which the client and server encrypts information over the network connection. Selecting a good cipher suite is critical for the application's data security, confidentiality and performance. The names should be in OpenSSL string format (not RFC format). All default values and examples provided by EMQX config documentation are all in OpenSSL format.
NOTE: Certain cipher suites are only compatible with specific TLS versions ('tlsv1.1', 'tlsv1.2' or 'tlsv1.3') incompatible cipher suites will be silently dropped. For instance, if only 'tlsv1.3' is given in the versions, configuring cipher suites for other versions will have no effect.
NOTE: PSK ciphers are suppressed by 'tlsv1.3' version config
If PSK cipher suites are intended, 'tlsv1.3' should be disabled from versions.
PSK cipher suites: "RSA-PSK-AES256-GCM-SHA384,RSA-PSK-AES256-CBC-SHA384, RSA-PSK-AES128-GCM-SHA256,RSA-PSK-AES128-CBC-SHA256, RSA-PSK-AES256-CBC-SHA,RSA-PSK-AES128-CBC-SHA, RSA-PSK-DES-CBC3-SHA,RSA-PSK-RC4-SHA"
ciphers.label: ciphers

secure_renegotiate.description:
SSL parameter renegotiation is a feature that allows a client and a server
to renegotiate the parameters of the SSL connection on the fly.
RFC 5746 defines a more secure way of doing this. By enabling secure renegotiation,
you drop support for the insecure renegotiation, prone to MitM attacks.
secure_renegotiate.label: secure_renegotiate

dhfile.description:
Path to a file containing PEM-encoded Diffie Hellman parameters to be used by the server if a cipher suite using Diffie Hellman key exchange is negotiated. If not specified, default parameters are used.
NOTE: The dhfile option is not supported by TLS 1.3.
dhfile.label: dhfile

client_renegotiation.description:
In protocols that support client-initiated renegotiation,
the cost of resources of such an operation is higher for the server than the client.
This can act as a vector for denial of service attacks.
The SSL application already takes measures to counter-act such attempts,
but client-initiated renegotiation can be strictly disabled by setting this option to false.
The default value is true. Note that disabling renegotiation can result in
long-lived connections becoming unusable due to limits on
the number of messages the underlying cipher suite can encipher.
client_renegotiation.label: client_renegotiation

handshake_timeout.description: Maximum time duration allowed for the handshake to complete
handshake_timeout.label: handshake_timeout

enable.description: Set to false to disable this auth provider
enable.label: enable

ciphers.description:
This config holds TLS cipher suite names separated by comma, or as an array of strings. e.g. "TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384,TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256" or ["TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384","TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256"].
Ciphers (and their ordering) define the way in which the client and server encrypts information over the network connection. Selecting a good cipher suite is critical for the application's data security, confidentiality and performance. The names should be in OpenSSL string format (not RFC format). All default values and examples provided by EMQX config documentation are all in OpenSSL format.
NOTE: Certain cipher suites are only compatible with specific TLS versions ('tlsv1.1', 'tlsv1.2' or 'tlsv1.3') incompatible cipher suites will be silently dropped. For instance, if only 'tlsv1.3' is given in the versions, configuring cipher suites for other versions will have no effect.
NOTE: PSK ciphers are suppressed by 'tlsv1.3' version config
If PSK cipher suites are intended, 'tlsv1.3' should be disabled from versions.
PSK cipher suites: "RSA-PSK-AES256-GCM-SHA384,RSA-PSK-AES256-CBC-SHA384, RSA-PSK-AES128-GCM-SHA256,RSA-PSK-AES128-CBC-SHA256, RSA-PSK-AES256-CBC-SHA,RSA-PSK-AES128-CBC-SHA, RSA-PSK-DES-CBC3-SHA,RSA-PSK-RC4-SHA"
NOTE: QUIC listener supports only 'tlsv1.3' ciphers
ciphers.label: ciphers

enable.description: Set to false to disable this auth provider
enable.label: enable

servers.description:
A Node list for Cluster to connect to. The nodes should be split with ',', such as: 'Node[,Node]'
For each Node should be:
The IPv4 or IPv6 address or host name to connect to.
A host entry has the following form: 'Host[:Port]'
The MongoDB default port 27017 is used if '[:Port]' isn't present
servers.label: servers

listeners.description:
HTTP(s) listeners are identified by their protocol type and are used to serve dashboard UI and restful HTTP API.
Listeners must have a unique combination of port number and IP address.
For example, an HTTP listener can listen on all configured IP addresses on a given port for a machine by specifying the IP address 0.0.0.0.
Alternatively, the HTTP listener can specify a unique IP address for each listener, but use the same port.
listeners.label: listeners

default_password.description:
The initial default password for dashboard 'admin' user.
For safety, it should be changed as soon as possible.
default_password.label: default_password

cors.description:
Support Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS).
Allows a server to indicate any origins (domain, scheme, or port) other than
its own from which a browser should permit loading resources.
cors.label: cors

authentication.description: Per-listener authentication override Authentication can be one single authenticator instance or a chain of authenticators as an array. When authenticating a login (username, client ID, etc.) the authenticators are checked in the configured order.
authentication.label: authentication

listeners.description: MQTT listeners identified by their protocol type and assigned names
listeners.label: listeners

zones.description:
A zone is a set of configs grouped by the zone name.
For flexible configuration mapping, the name can be set to a listener's zone config.
NOTE: A built-in zone named default is auto created and can not be deleted.
zones.label: zones

mqtt.description:
Global MQTT configuration.
The configs here work as default values which can be overridden in zone configs
mqtt.label: mqtt

node.description: Node name, cookie, config & data directories and the Erlang virtual machine (BEAM) boot parameters.
node.label: node

cluster.description:
EMQX nodes can form a cluster to scale up the total capacity.
Here holds the configs to instruct how individual nodes can discover each other.
cluster.label: cluster

log.description: Configure logging backends (to console or to file), and logging level for each logger backend.
log.label: log

force_gc.description:
Force the MQTT connection process garbage collection after
this number of messages or bytes have passed through.
force_gc.label: force_gc

trace.description: Real-time filtering logs for the ClientID or Topic or IP for debugging.
trace.label: trace
